episode.description: Discover story behind the "36 Views of Mt. Fuji" woodprint series; "The Great Wave off Kanagawa" by Hokusai. It is not just a huge wave and Mt. Fuji, the boat caught in the wave have a reason.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE(1)

episode.description: The top 3 geisha idol celebrities in Edo: Tomimoto Toyohina, Takashima Ohisa, and Naniwaya Kita. See how Kitagawa Utamaro, the master of female beauty has illustrated them so differently.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE(2)

episode.description: At dusk in summer, a woman is absorbed in reading a letter. This chic lady is actually an advertisement model for Mitsui Echigoya, one of the top kimono fabric stores in Edo.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE(3)

episode.description: With its splendid branches and white plum blossoms, this famous painting is known for captivating Van Gogh. Discover why people were able to tell this was a specific tree at Kameido Umeyashiki.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE(4)

episode.description: Mornings begin early for fishmongers and vegetable peddlers at Nihonbashi Bridge, and here is a reason. They are not going to bow to the lord's procession. The bustling scene from everyday Edo life.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE(5)

episode.description: A man strikes a pose in an iconic woodblock print by the artist Sharaku. Who is the mysterious figure... and what is he doing? And why did the artist want to commemorate the moment?
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: The Piercing Gaze

episode.description: We observe "Red Fuji" and "Black Fuji," 2 dramatically different views of Japan's most famous mountain, captured by the artist Hokusai. What did Mount Fuji mean to the people of Edo?
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Mt. Fuji's Faces

episode.description: We come across a tranquil, snow-covered Edo cityscape. But there's something in the air: the aroma of foods both sweet and savory that helped the townspeople keep warm in the winter.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: On a Snowy Night

episode.description: Caught in an evening shower, Edo townspeople scramble across a bridge in search of shelter. On the river beyond, a lone figure steers his boat, unfazed by the rain. What is his destination?
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Sudden Shower

episode.description: On those hot, humid summer nights, nothing can get in the way of sleep like mosquitoes on the hunt. We learn about the tools the Edo townspeople had at their disposal to fight the pesky insects.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: A Bedtime Routine

episode.description: We visit the Yoshiwara district, Edo's most prominent pleasure quarters. Among the lavish spenders, courtesans and apprentices, small humanoid creatures scurry about - what could they be up to?
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Good or Evil Soul

episode.description: It's late at night, when all are fast asleep. A young man and woman huddle together along the veranda outside of a house, attending to a ... rooster. What could the pair be up to?
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: A Secret Date

episode.description: We visit one of the most famous cherry blossom spots in Edo. Flower viewing parties were for eating, drinking and making merry. It was also an opportunity for young men and women to mingle.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: A Spring Party

episode.description: A series of doodles by the famous artist Utagawa Kuniyoshi turn out to be carefully considered depictions of the kabuki actors of the day. What kind of artistic statement was he trying to make?
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Doodles or Ukiyoe

episode.description: We venture to the outskirts of Edo just after sunset, where a group of women and children have come to a stream to enjoy a popular summer activity. What could they be looking for among the weeds?
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Summer Light Show

episode.description: Workers at a sawmill use the latest tools and their honed skills to prepare the building blocks of Edo life: long, narrow beams, bamboo stems and leftover wood stacked as high as buildings.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Riverside Sawmill

episode.description: In the Edo period, childbirth was a community affair, with the mother-to-be attended by a midwife and the women in her life. It was also characterized by unique customs and superstitions.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: First Childbirth

episode.description: A group of anglers stand in a fast-moving, undulating river at the foot of a rugged cliff. They use "drifting mosquito hooks" to fish for a summer delicacy that was a favorite of the Edo townspeople.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Summer Delicacy

episode.description: For a time during the Edo period, fireworks lit up the skies practically every night in the summer. It was a chance for women to dress up and let loose ... and grab the attention of male suitors.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: A Fashion Night

episode.description: Edo was a city of waterways. The Yoroi Ferry transported people across the Nihonbashi River, one of its main commercial arteries. For the captain, it was a high-pressure job requiring skill and guts.
episode.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE: Edo's Rush Hour
